Outstation buyers are now preferring online purchases, leading to a nearly 50% drop in footfall at wholesale hubs like Sadar Bazaar and Chandni Chowk. While some markets remain unaffected, others, like Lajpat Rai Market, are almost entirely shut, with fear and economic impact lingering.

items.title: Tata Motors (CV) Q2: First results post-listing show Rs 867 crore YoY loss on Tata Capital mark-down; revenue up 6%
items.summary: Tata Motors CV Q2 Results: Tata Motors Ltd on Thursday reported a consolidated net loss at Rs 867 crore versus a net profit of Rs 498 crore in the year ago period. The company's revenue form operations in the quarter stood at Rs 18,585 crore, up 6% over Rs 17,535 crore in the corresponding quarter of the last financial year.

items.title: Indian mutual funds pivot to ultra-short debt as rate outlook clouds bets
items.summary: India's mutual funds will stick with ultra-short-term bonds as an uncertain interest rate outlook and global trade concerns curb appetite for long-tenor securities, fund managers said.

items.title: Euro zone government bond yields edge up, Germany in focus
items.summary: Bund yields edged higher on Thursday after dropping slightly the day before as the European Central Bank was firmly on hold and recent German economic data increased uncertainty about the size and timing of a boost from Germany's planned spending push.

items.title: SpiceJet expands fleet with five new Boeing 737s, daily flights surge to 176
items.summary: With these additions, SpiceJet’s operational fleet now stands at 35 aircraft. The five planes newly inducted in the fleet have already started their commercial operations, thereby improving the connectivity of the routes with high demand, both domestic and international.

items.title: India to stay fastest-growing major economy despite US tariff hikes: Moody’s
items.summary: The rating agency said that despite higher tariffs imposed by the Donald Trump administration in the US, India’s economic momentum remains resilient.

items.title: Voltas Q2 Results: Profit plunges 76% to Rs 31 crore
items.summary: Air-conditioning manufacturer and engineering services provider Voltas Ltd on Thursday reported a 76.28 per cent decline in consolidated net profit to Rs 31.5 crore for the September quarter of FY26, as a subdued summer season and GST-related demand deferment weighed on its cooling business.

items.title: Belgium's Lotus Bakeries sets sights on India’s middle-class cookie jar
items.summary: Lotus Bakeries has partnered with Mondelez to expand the Biscoff brand in India's growing biscuit market. It aims to become the third-largest cookie brand globally, with India playing a key role in its ambitions.

items.title: Jubilant Foodworks Q2 net profit up twofold to Rs 194.6cr, revenue up 19.7 pc to Rs 2,340 cr
items.summary: Jubilant Foodworks Ltd (JFL), which operates fast-food chains - Domino's Pizza and Dunkin' Donuts - on Thursday reported an over twofold jump in its consolidated net profit of Rs 194.6 crore in the September quarter of FY26.

items.title: Torsten Schmidt named MD & CEO of Daimler India
items.summary: He succeeds Satyakam Arya, who has been named as the designated President and CEO of Hino Motors in Japan

items.title: itel launches A90 Limited Edition 128GB: Check what makes this budget phone stand out
items.summary: The A90 limited edition has an internal storage of 128GB, giving the users the possibility to store more pictures, movies, and applications without the fear of the storage getting full.

items.title: Nippon Life India AMC and DWS enter into MoU to scale-up AIF segment
items.summary: Nippon Life India Asset Management and DWS Group have signed an agreement. DWS will invest in Nippon Life India AIF Management. This will help grow Nippon India's alternatives business. The partnership aims to build a global alternatives platform. It will also launch passive products for Indian and global markets. This collaboration combines Indian and global expertise.

items.title: India’s macro strengths return as markets eye next leg up:  Devang Mehta
items.summary: India may be on the verge of an earnings revival after a year of underperformance, says Devang Mehta of Spark Capital. With inflation at multi-year lows, supportive policy, rising consumption and improving management commentary, markets could enter an upgrade cycle. Mehta expects FII flows to return and sees strong opportunities in capex, financialization and discretionary consumption.

items.title: BDL Q2 results: Standalone profit jumps 76% YoY to  ₹216 crore
items.summary: BDL Q2 results: Bharat Dynamics reported a 76.2% YoY increase in standalone profit for Q2FY26, reaching  ₹215.88 crore. The company's total revenue for the quarter was  ₹1,147.03 crore, marking a 110.55% YoY rise.

items.title: IndiGo Stretch completes a year: Here are the hits and misses
items.summary: The airline changes plan to operate 12 domestic routes with the business class product in one year and starts deploying it on international sectors, creating a mismatch in product offering.

items.title: Stock markets end with marginal gains amid volatile trade, foreign fund outflows

items.title: Ericsson sets up Radio Access Network R&D unit in Bengaluru to drive 5G software development
items.summary: Ericsson has opened a new Radio Access Network software research and development unit in Bengaluru. This facility will focus on creating advanced 5G features. The move strengthens Ericsson's research operations in India. It also helps build the country's telecom ecosystem.

items.title: Industry urges retention of quality control norms to boost local manufacturing
items.summary: India's push for local manufacturing is gaining momentum, with industry leaders advocating for the retention of Quality Control Orders (QCOs). These orders have restricted Chinese imports, leading to increased domestic production and capacity expansion across various sectors. Manufacturers express concern over potential rollbacks, emphasising the need for policy stability to sustain the 'Make in India' initiative and boost exports.

items.title: Penny stock under  ₹5 to be in focus on Friday; here's why
items.summary: Nandan Denim's shares may attract investor interest as the company reported Q2FY26 revenue of  ₹784.69 crore, a 7.7% YoY decline. Despite a drop in EBITDA and margins, net profit increased 7.6% YoY. The stock has lost 18% in four months but shows strong long-term growth.

items.title: Gainers & Losers: Ashok Leyland among 7 stocks that hogged limelight on Thursday
items.summary: Benchmark indices ended flat with a positive bias as gains in banking and pharma stocks were offset by losses in IT, auto, and FMCG. Several major stocks saw sharp moves.

items.title: India has potential to be among top markets for Biscoff, launched in partnership with Mondelez, says Lotus Bakeries

items.title: Broker’s call: Ashok Leyland (Buy)
items.summary: HDFC Securities

items.title: India's power demand slips 5.2% in October amid unseasonal rains: Report
items.summary: Thermal power generation was particularly affected, with the all-India plant load factor (PLF) plunging to 57.5%, marking a four-year low

items.title: Stakeholders, experts from 7 countries to participate in Global Energy Leaders' Summit in Puri
items.summary: Puri will host the Global Energy Leaders' Summit from December 5-7. Experts and stakeholders from Canada, Brazil, Singapore, and other nations will attend. The summit, an initiative of the Odisha Government's Department of Energy, aims to share best practices in the energy sector. Its theme is 'Powering India: Sufficiency, Balance, Innovation'.

items.title: Mutual Funds’ October Shuffle: Banks in, IT & FMCG out - Here’s full list of stocks they bought and sold
items.summary: In October, Indian mutual funds reshuffled their portfolios with a clear tilt towards financial stocks, while trimming exposure to IT, FMCG, and select industrial names.

items.title: Eicher Motors Q2 results: Net profit up 24% YoY at Rs 1,369 crore; Royal Enfield posts record sales
items.summary: Eicher Motors Ltd on Thursday reported a 24 per cent year-on-year rise in consolidated profit after tax to Rs 1,369 crore for the quarter ended September 30, 2025, supported by robust performance across both Royal Enfield and its commercial vehicle business.

items.title: Tata Motors PV Q2 preview: Earnings may hit a road bump on JLR cyber glitch. Revenue likely to drop up to 7.2% YoY. 5 things to watch
items.summary: Tata Motors Passenger Vehicles will announce its September quarter earnings on November 14 amid the aftermath of a cyberattack at Jaguar Land Rover. Analysts expect revenue and PAT to show mixed trends, with domestic PV margins resilient, while JLR performance and global demand remain key monitorables for investors.

items.summary: The 111 markets contributed $8,489.08 million during April-September 2025

items.summary: PlaySimple IPO expected to hit market in first half of next year

items.title: Delhi Airport to get Terminal 4? DIAL’s 2026 Master Plan to decide fate of T2, T3
items.summary: Delhi's Indira Gandhi International Airport is set to finalize its Master Plan 2026 by March. This plan will shape the airport's future, including terminal operations and expansion. Capacity will increase by 20% by 2029-30. Terminal 3 will boost international capacity by 50% from January 2026. These changes aim to meet growing aviation demand.

items.title: Rupee falls 6 paise to close at 88.68 against U.S. dollar
items.summary: Forex traders said the rupee is trading in a tight range, as an overnight decline in crude oil prices and renewed optimism over U.S.-India trade talks provided a steady anchor and restricted the downfall

items.summary: The vessel is the second of the two SOVs being constructed by CSL for North Star and the construction cost per vessel is estimated at ₹500 crore

items.title: AWL Agri Business feels the heat as cheaper soybean oil from Nepal floods Indian market
items.summary: Zero-duty imports under SAFTA dent Fortune, King’s sales; AWL’s soybean oil share slips by 2.5–3%

items.title: Ashtech Group enters real estate; to invest Rs 1,800 cr on 1st Greater Noida project
items.summary: Ashtech Group, a construction materials and infrastructure firm, is entering the real estate sector with a luxury housing project in Greater Noida, valued at approximately Rs 1,800 crore. The company acquired a 5.6-acre plot for Rs 300 crore and plans to launch the first phase soon, leveraging its expertise from allied sectors.

items.title: Air India Crash: Probe meant to find causes, not fix blame, says Supreme Court
items.summary: The court was hearing petitions filed by the family of late Captain Sumeet Sabharwal, the Pilot-in-Command of the ill-fated flight, and by aviation safety NGO Safety Matters Foundation, which alleged procedural lapses in the AAIB investigation.

items.title: Ministry of Agriculture seeks public feedback on Draft Seeds Bill 2025
items.summary: The Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare has released the draft Seeds Bill, 2025, for public consultation, aiming to replace older legislation and modernize seed regulation. The proposed bill focuses on quality, affordability, innovation through liberalized imports, and farmer rights, while decriminalizing minor offenses to ease business compliance.

items.title: IT unemployment rate hits 4-year high at 7.2%
items.summary: Only 1.8% net employment growth recorded as companies focus on niche digital roles

items.title: Rupee falls 6 paise to close at 88.68 against US dollar
items.summary: The rupee consolidated in a narrow range and settled for the day lower by 6 paise at 88.68 (provisional) against the US dollar on Thursday, as foreign fund outflows and continuous dollar demand from local importers, including oil companies, exerted pressure on the local currency.

items.title: Power of SIP: Want Rs 4 crore in 29 years? Here’s how much you may need to invest every month
items.summary: It's a long term investment, where you invest an amount every month, on this principal amount an interest is generated every month, based on the time you selected and interest.

items.title: India’s biggest asset manager SBI Funds Management targets $1.2 billion IPO in H1 2026
items.summary: SBI Funds Management Ltd. is planning a significant initial public offering. The asset manager aims to raise as much as $1.2 billion. This IPO could take place in Mumbai during the first half of 2026. Banks will be invited to pitch for mandates soon. SBI Funds may be valued at $12 billion.

items.title: Jockey India licensee Page Industries’ Q2 FY26 profit drops marginally on subdued demand
items.summary: Apparel maker reports profit of ₹194.8 crore for quarter ended September 30, down from ₹195.3 crore a year ago

items.title: From Hollywood to streaming, AI is firmly in show business—and it isn’t leaving anytime soon
items.summary: Despite earlier resistance in Hollywood, artificial intelligence has found a firm foothold in the industry—powering performances, enhancing visuals and even helping Oscar-winning films. Yet, concerns over deepfakes, copyright violations and the risk of creativity being displaced continue to linger.

items.title: Leading British chefs appeal to save London's iconic Indian restaurant Veeraswamy
items.summary: Last summer, Veeraswamy owners MW Eat were informed that its lease would not be renewed because the Crown Estate wants to extend the ground floor reception area for the offices on the building's upper floors.

items.title: Deutsche Bank's DWS to buy 40% stake in Nippon Life India unit
items.summary: Nippon Life India Asset Management is joining forces with Germany's DWS Group, a major European asset manager. DWS plans to acquire a significant minority stake in NAM India's AIF subsidiary to build a joint Alternative Investment Fund business. The collaboration also targets passive investment products and global distribution, marking a strategic expansion for both firms.

items.title: Keep your interest rate reasonable: DFS Secretary to MFIs
items.summary: Financial Services Secretary M Nagaraju has called on microfinance institutions to keep interest rates reasonable. This move aims to boost financial inclusion and prevent a rise in stressed assets. He highlighted the importance of cost efficiency and productivity for MFIs.

items.title: Market Wrap: D-St rally loses steam as Sensex, Nifty end flat awaiting Bihar poll results
items.summary: Indian stocks experienced a pause on Thursday, with the Sensex and Nifty closing largely unchanged as a four-day rally lost steam. While easing inflation and hopes for an India-U.S. trade deal provided some support, caution ahead of Bihar election results tempered market sentiment.

items.title: Can’t be a global brand without India, says Lotus Biscoff maker
items.summary: Lotus Bakeries is partnering with Mondelez International to boost Biscoff's presence in India, aiming for the market to become a top four global sales driver. This collaboration leverages Mondelez's extensive distribution network to tap into India's young consumer base and the significant biscuit market, with a target of $100 million in sales within five years.

items.title: Domestic construction equipment to clock 2-4% volume growth in FY26, FY27: Crisil
items.summary: The domestic construction equipment industry is projected to see 2-4% volume growth this fiscal and next, despite subdued demand from moderating real estate and slower road construction. Revenue, however, is expected to increase by 6-8% due to selective price hikes and firm export realisations. Operating margins are anticipated to remain stable around 11%.

items.title: Zydus’ Amplitude receives CE mark for its robotic surgical system ‘Andy’
items.summary: This approval means the product complies with European standards for safety, performance, and quality, according to a statement

items.title: NSE investor accounts cross 24 crore as small-town India joins the D-St rush
items.summary: India's National Stock Exchange (NSE) reported a significant milestone, surpassing 24 crore unique trading accounts in November 2025. This surge, driven by digitalization and policy support, reflects growing retail confidence and has led to a 22-year high in investor ownership of listed companies.

items.title: Royal Enfield motorcycle maker posts higher second-quarter profit
items.summary: The company said its consolidated net profit rose 24.5% year-on-year to 13.69 billion rupees ($155.75 million) in the three months to September 30

items.title: Mint Explainer | How India is emerging as the epicentre of global energy demand
items.summary: With prospects of continued growth in industries and transportation, India is expected to emerge as the driving force of global energy demand. What are the factors behind the projected demand growth, and what does it mean for India?

items.title: Top Gainers & Losers on Nov 13: Ashok Leyland, Asian Paints, Hindustan Zinc, Hindalco Industries among top gainers
items.summary: The Indian stock market saw slight cooling after a three-day rally, with Nifty 50 closing flat. Traders awaited Bihar election results, impacting government policy. Nifty Metal led gains, while Nifty PSU Bank lagged.&nbsp;

items.title: Sensex, Nifty 50 end flat ahead of Bihar election outcome— 10 key highlights from the Indian stock market today
items.summary: The Sensex ended at 84,478.67, up 12 points, or 0.01 per cent, while the Nifty 50 settled at 25,879.15, up 3 points, or 0.01 per cent. The BSE Midcap index fell 0.34 per cent, and the Smallcap index declined 0.30 per cent.

items.title: Juniper Green Energy, GUVNL sign PPA for 50 MW wind project
items.summary: Juniper Green Energy has secured a significant deal with Gujarat Urja Vikas Nigam Limited. A 50 megawatt wind energy project will be developed in Gujarat. Power supply is slated to begin from November 6, 2027. This power purchase agreement spans 25 years. The agreement was finalized on November 7.

items.title: Moody’s Ratings sees India economy powering ahead at 6.5% through 2027
items.summary: The rating agency said government-led capital expenditure and resilient household consumption will continue to power the country's economy, even as private investment stays cautious.

items.title: BlackRock turns bullish on India; Ben Powell says market rebound is coming as valuations reset and US trade tensions ease
items.summary: BlackRock’s Ben Powell says India is poised for a market rebound as valuations normalise, US–India trade tensions ease and global AI-driven flows rebalance. He urges investors to shift from passive investing to more active, selective strategies amid geopolitical fragmentation and technological disruption. Powell remains bullish on India, US equities, Japan and India’s high-yielding local currency bonds over the next year.

items.title: FII holding of India equities hits 15-year low at Rs 75.2 lakh crore: NSE report
items.summary: Foreign investors have significantly reduced their Indian equity holdings, reaching a 15-year low due to substantial sell-offs. This decline contrasts with domestic mutual funds, which have achieved record ownership across market segments, surpassing foreign investors for the fourth consecutive quarter. Individual investors' overall share remained stable, though their mid and small-cap holdings increased.

items.title: Eicher Motors Q2 Results: Net profit rises 24% to  ₹1,369 crore; revenue jumps 45% YoY — Details here
items.summary: Eicher Motors recorded a 24% rise in its net profit to  ₹1,369 crore in the July-September quarter of the 2025-26 fiscal year. The company's revenues jumped 45% YoY on a consolidated basis. Here's how the company has performed in its Q2 results 2025.&nbsp;

items.title: Eicher Motors Q2 Results: Cons PAT jumps 24% YoY to Rs 1,369 crore; revenue zooms 45%
items.summary: Eicher Motors Q2 Results:  The company’s revenue from operations in the quarter under review stood at Rs 6,172 crore, up 45% from Rs 4,263.07 crore in the corresponding quarter of the previous financial year.

items.title: Where are the movies for the masses? Single-screen theatres rue a year of blockbuster drought
items.summary: India’s box office this year has leaned heavily toward metros and premium formats, leaving single-screen theatres struggling. With few mass hits beyond Chhaava and several big titles delayed to 2026, single-screen theatres have seen a 20-30% drop in earnings and hope for a revival early next year.

items.title: Otis India doubles new equipment orders in three years, expands Bengaluru facility by 20%
items.summary: Sebi Joseph, President of Otis India, told businessline that India has emerged as Otis’s fastest-growing market among large economies, and is now one of only two global escalator manufacturing hubs for the company, alongside China

items.title: Noida International Airport to commence operations soon
items.summary: The Noida International Airport at Jewar is nearing completion and is set to begin operations shortly. Tata Projects, the builder, confirmed that regulatory approvals are progressing well. The airport is ready for inauguration. The company is also expanding its portfolio with new projects in emerging sectors. This strategic shift is expected to improve profitability from next year.

items.title: Stock market loss: Household equity wealth drops by Rs 2.6 lakh crore in Q2
items.summary: India's household equity wealth saw a Rs 2.6 lakh crore decline in Q2 FY26 due to market selloffs and foreign outflows. Despite this quarterly dip, cumulative wealth since April 2020 remains strong, driven by rising investor participation and robust market performance.

items.title: RBI repo rate cut hopes rise as retail inflation hits record low. But will the central bank blink?
items.summary: The challenge for the RBI is striking a balance between nurturing growth and maintaining financial stability. The central bank has also been mindful of policy transmission risks — past rate cuts have not always translated into lower borrowing costs across the economy.

items.title: Top banks may witness re-rating, corporate loan growth likely to surprise: Gurmeet Chadha
items.summary: India's top banks are poised for a re-rating as interest rates stabilize and credit growth accelerates. Analysts anticipate improving net interest margins and strong corporate loan book expansion, boosting valuations for major lenders like ICICI, HDFC, and SBI.

items.title: South Africa’s Rand Breaches 17 Per Dollar First Time Since 2023
items.summary: The rand strengthened below 17 per dollar for the first time since February 2023 after the government adopted a lower inflation target, suggesting interest rates may stay higher for longer than previously anticipated.

items.title: FIIs trim stake in Reliance Industries in Q2 but retail, MF raise bet
items.summary: Retail and mutual fund investors raised their stakes in Reliance Industries during the September 2025 quarter, signalling domestic confidence despite a 9% stock dip, even as FIIs reduced holdings and turned cautious on Indian equities.

This performance highlights the sector's resilience. Key markets like the UAE and Japan saw significant gains. Ready-Made Garments and Jute sectors were major contributors. This expansion supports government initiatives for export diversification.

items.title: Gold prices on MCX jumps nearly by  ₹9,000 from recent low. Should you buy or wait for a correction?
items.summary: According to Rahul Kalantri, VP Commodities, Mehta Equities Ltd, the near-term technical postures for gold and silver have turned more bullish recently, which is inviting the chart-based speculators to play the long sides of both markets.

items.summary: At least 15 PMS funds across small-cap, sectoral and multi-cap themes delivered stellar October returns, led by Sundaram Alternate Assets’ Rising Stars with 10.5%. Fintech, healthcare and thematic portfolios dominated gains, while only a few hybrid and large-cap strategies lagged.

items.title: Why AI's next smart move might be scrapping chatbots
items.summary: Chatbots have dominated the way we interact with artificial intelligence (AI). However, companies are starting to question if it's the best AI interface—risks abound of circumventing safety guardrails, unpredictability and inefficiency. They might disappear soon—but what will replace them?

items.title: PhonePe integrates ChatGPT: Indian users get AI-powered assistance in-app — here's how it works
items.summary: PhonePe has joined hands with OpenAI to bring ChatGPT directly into its app, offering AI-powered assistance for millions of Indian users. From travel planning to shopping, here's how the integration will transform the digital payments experience in India.&nbsp;

items.title: LAT Aviation's UAV 'almost ready for flight', expected to have 60-min range: Deepinder Goyal
items.summary: Eternal founder Deepinder Goyal's aerospace venture, LAT Aerospace, is nearing flight tests for its all-electric, fixed-wing UAV. This new generation Short Take-Off and Landing (STOL) aircraft boasts a 60-minute endurance and can autonomously cruise from Mumbai to Pune. The company is also developing hybrid-electric propulsion and its own gas turbine engines.

items.title: Govt to soon allocate Rs 2,000 cr for Credit Guarantee Scheme for Exporters
items.summary: The government is set to launch a new Credit Guarantee Scheme for Exporters. This initiative will provide Rs 2,000 crore in funding. It aims to enable up to Rs 20,000 crore in additional credit for eligible exporters. This move is expected to boost global competitiveness and support market diversification.

items.title: Supreme Court reserves verdict on whether insolvent telcos RCom, Aircel can sell spectrum to repay lenders
items.summary: The court is hearing a batch of petitions filed by SBI and the two insolvent telcos that challenged the NCLAT's 2021 order which held that spectrum could be transferred or sold under an insolvency resolution plan only after all government dues were cleared.

items.title: Sunil Singhania-led Abakkus strengthens exposure to building material business, invests Rs 95 cr in Ahmedabad-based Match Graphics

items.title: WinZO, Balaji Telefilms partner to build India’s first transmedia microdrama universe

This collaboration aims to create cinema-grade microdramas for a global audience, leveraging WinZO's extensive user base and Balaji's storytelling expertise to tap into the rapidly growing short-form entertainment market.

items.title: European shares steady with focus on upcoming US data; Siemens slides
items.summary: European shares were steady on Thursday, as investors braced for crucial U.S. economic data following the end of the nation's longest government shutdown, while losses in Siemens also limited gains after it reported underwhelming earnings.

The government stated the investigation adheres to International Civil Aviation Organisation standards. This is due to foreign nationals among the victims. The court asked the petitioners to file their responses. The crash occurred in June, killing 260 people.

The MSME sector is a significant contributor to India's economy and employment.

Sensex, Nifty, Share Prices Highlights: Equity benchmark indices Sensex and Nifty continued their upward momentum for the third straight day on Wednesday, supported by gains in IT and consumer durables shares amid a rally in global equities markets.

Traders said optimism over the anticipated resolution of the US government shutdown and growing expectations of interest rate cuts by the Federal Reserve also bolstered the sentiment.

The 30-share BSE Sensex rallied 595.19 points, or 0.71 per cent, to settle at 84,466.51. It gained up to 780.69 points or 0.93 per cent to hit an intraday high of 8

items.title: Trump announces plan to lower tariffs on India amid talks on a 'fair deal'
items.summary: New Delhi and Washington continue work on a proposed bilateral trade agreement (BTA), the first tranche of which is targeted for completion soon. The deal aims to more than double bilateral trade to $500 billion by 2030, from the current $191 billion. Officials said India is awaiting a response from the US on the trade deal, and that another round of talks is not needed at this juncture.

items.title: Centre to dissolve Gati Shakti’s Network Planning Group, set up unified transport planning body
items.summary: The idea is to have a structured framework for master planning of transport development in the country and have a data repository that can help in future planning and policy interventions. To be created on the lines of similar unified institutions in the US, UK and Germany, the Indian entity will come up with comprehensive, long-term strategies for transport-related sectors to reduce costs, increase efficiency, and promote integrated multimodal corridors.

items.title: India, New Zealand near trade pact

Discussions with the EU are also progressing, and Trade Commissioner Maros Šefovi is expected in mid-December. Additionally, the GCC, Bahrain, Qatar, and Israel have expressed interest in trade agreements.

items.title: Belgium to share past financial data with India under revised tax treaty
items.summary: Some of the stipulations of the amended treaty are: a contracting state cannot decline to supply info solely because it has no domestic interest in such information; info cannot be held back on the grounds that it is held by a bank or financial institution or nominees or person acting in a fiduciary capacity; and, the state which receives request or tax claim must take "measures conservancy" - like freezing assets - even if it is owed by a person who has the right to prevent its collection.
